items.title: docs: mocha definition is hardly readable

labels.name: website
labels.description: involving mochajs.org, but not necessarily involving docs

items.body:
- [x] Checked that your issue hasn't already been filed by cross-referencing [issues with the `faq` label](https://github.com/mochajs/mocha/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20label%3Afaq%20)
- [x] Checked next-gen ES issues and syntax problems by using the same environment and/or transpiler configuration without Mocha to ensure it isn't just a feature that actually isn't supported in the environment in question or a bug in your code.
- [x] 'Smoke tested' the code to be tested by running it outside the real test suite to get a better sense of whether the problem is in the code under test, your usage of Mocha, or Mocha itself
- [x] Ensured that there is no discrepancy between the locally and globally installed versions of Mocha. You can find them with: `node node_modules/.bin/mocha --version`(Local) and `mocha --version`(Global). We recommend that you _not_ install Mocha globally.

### Description
Document page mocha definition is hard to read due to '200' font weight. 

![mocha bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70274294/141933742-427d8f53-a4ca-4f50-b936-70c9409795ed.png)

items.title: RFC: Add support for computing the reciprocal cube root (rcbrt)

labels.name: basic
labels.description: Low degree of difficulty. Should be straightforward to implement and/or resolve.

labels.name: good-first-issue
labels.description: A good first issue for new contributors!

items.body:
<!--lint disable first-heading-level-->

## Checklist

> Please ensure the following tasks are completed before submitting a feature request.

-   [x] Read and understood the [Code of Conduct][code-of-conduct].
-   [x] Searched for existing issues and pull requests.
-   [x] The issue name begins with `RFC:`.

## Description

> Description of the feature request.

This RFC proposes adding support for computing the reciprocal cube root (i.e., 1/cbrt(x)). The implementation is trivial:

```javascript
/**
* @param {number} x - input value
* @returns {number} reciprocal cube root
*/
function rcbrt( x ) {
    return 1.0 / cbrt( x );
}
```

The rationale behind providing this API is to provide a declarative interface, rather than imperatively writing out the intended behavior. As the implementation is small, modern compilers should readily inline the implementation, thus not affecting performance if used within other implementations.

Package: `@stdlib/math/base/special/rcbrt`
Alias: `rcbrt`.

## Related Issues

> Does this feature request have any related issues?

No.

## Questions

> Any questions for reviewers?

No.

## Other

> Any other information relevant to this feature request? This may include screenshots, references, sample output, and/or implementation notes.

No.

<!-- <links> -->

[code-of-conduct]: https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

<!-- </links> -->

items.title: Without the Hot Air v1.1
items.body: ## Tasks * [ ] Format math equations properly (using remark-math?) * [ ] Proofing * [ ] remove websitetitle stuff e.g. `doi:10.1016/0196-8904(95)00306-1` `[www.ingentaconnect.com/content/els/01968904/1996/00000037/00000006/art00306](http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/els/01968904/1996/00000037/00000006/art00306)` * [ ] Fix internal chapter links e.g. currently a link to chapter 24 has link https://climate.lifeitself.us/without-hot-air/Text/chap24.xhtml#lithium * [ ] Revision / corrections #16 * [ ] add annotation - see https://h.readthedocs.io/projects/client/en/latest/publishers/ * [ ] Revised / updated version (v2 - keep source as v1) Someday maybe * [ ] Nicer table of contents e.g. 3 col, color-coded like on https://www.withouthotair.com * [ ] (?) generate table of contents from structured data (e.g. json)

items.title: Cannot use auth.getCurrentUser with EmbeddedSDK
items.body:
## Description

```js
  const kuzzle = this.context.accessors.sdk

  await kuzzle.auth.login('local', { username, password })
  const user = await kuzzle.auth.getCurrentUser()
```

Error `Caught an unexpected plugin error: Cannot read property 'userId' of null\nThis is probably not a Kuzzle error, but a problem with a plugin implementation.`

items.title: Make the number of shards configurable for internal collections
items.body:
## Feature Description

Allows to modify the default number of shards for internal collections of the `kuzzle` index such as `users`.

:warning: The number of shards can only be set when the collection is created for the first time

items.body: Looking for `designers` who can help design some new trendy cursors for the library.

items.title: ConfirmEncryptionPublicKey story: convert knobs and actions to controls / args
items.body: **Describe the bug** As part of a push to convert all stories that use deprecated `@storybook/addon-knobs` and `@storybook/addon-actions` to use [controls](https://storybook.js.org/docs/react/essentials/controls) and [action argType annotation](https://storybook.js.org/docs/react/essentials/actions#action-argtype-annotation) Convert `ConfirmEncryptionPublicKey` story in `ui/pages/confirm-encryption-public-key/confirm-encryption-public-key.stories.js` to use [controls](https://storybook.js.org/docs/react/essentials/controls) and [action argType annotation](https://storybook.js.org/docs/react/essentials/actions#action-argtype-annotation) Read the [MetaMask extension storybook documentation guidelines](https://metamask.github.io/metamask-storybook/?path=/story/getting-started-documentation-guidelines--page) to get a better understanding of writing stories. Providing MDX documentation although helpful, is a bonus and not a requirement for this issue. To start storybook: ``` yarn storybook ``` **Requirements** - [ ] Story has `argTypes` that align with component api / props - [ ] All instances of `@storybook/addon-knobs` have been removed in favour of control args - [ ] All instances of `@storybook/addon-actions` have been removed in favour of [action argType annotation](https://storybook.js.org/docs/react/essentials/actions#action-argtype-annotation) Any further improvements to the story interaction or documentation is a bonus **Images**

items.title: Spinner component variations
items.body:
We are using this [spinner component](https://github.com/xh/hoist-react/blob/develop/cmp/spinner/Spinner.js) in a client app for two job states:  PENDING and PROCESSING.

It would be nice to have a way to show a spinning gear for the PROCESSING state.

This could be accomplished in one of three ways:

1. make a new component that uses the VM optimized gear
2. modify component to take a prop option string for image name for images that are built in:  'default', 'gear', 'dotdotdot', etc
3. modify component to take the actual image used as a prop

I'm in favor of #2, since it lets us make sure app developers do not load bonkers heavy animated gifs into the component, and we could always pretty easily add more image options once the pattern is in place.

items.title: Add upsertUser action
items.body:
## Feature Description

There is no `createOrReplaceUser` action because replacing an user will invalidate current sessions or API keys.

Instead we could have an `upsertUser` action that perform a create or an update of an user.

This is similar to [document:upsert](https://docs.kuzzle.io/core/2/api/controllers/document/upsert/)

items.title: Add mUserUpsert action
items.body:
## Description

Implements the multiple version of [security:upsertUser](https://github.com/kuzzleio/kuzzle/issues/2293): `mUpsertUser`

items.title: Create a link back to the SPDX main website
items.body: We're adding a link to the online tools from https://spdx.dev website.  It would be good to have a link to the main SPDX web page.  Perhaps the upper-left could be an SPDX logo with a link to the main web page.

items.title: Add support for documenting API
items.body: Although, the wiki [here](https://github.com/spdx/spdx-online-tools/wiki/REST-API-Fields-Request-and-Response) is enough to interact with the API but adding a support for [API documentation](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/topics/documenting-your-api) will help people new to the repo, understand what the API can do without access to source code. It will also help them to see all the API endpoints available so that they can use these endpoints to test and analyze the requests and responses of the API endpoints which is not really possible in entering curl commands.

items.title: Improve padding between settings and search box

labels.name: Sev3-low
labels.description: Low severity; minimal to no impact upon users

items.body: ### Describe the bug When the settings screen is shown in the popup, there's no padding between "Advanced" and the search box: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Open the settings screen from the popup 2. Click "Advanced" 3. See search with very little space between input and verbiage ### Error messages or log output _No response_ ### Version 10.10.0 ### Build type _No response_ ### Browser Chrome, Firefox ### Operating system MacOS ### Hardware wallet _No response_ ### Additional context _No response_

items.title: Add your participant profile JSON data
items.body:
Look at the dummy data in the `profiles.json` file. It looks like:
```js
    {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "roll_number": "LCS2020000",
        "age": "19",
        "hobbies": ["reading", "writing", "playing badminton", "singing"]
    }
```

Add data for yourself in the exact same format. All fields, name, roll_number, age and hobbies are compulsory. Make sure your roll number is accurate (don't make up something random!).

For your PR to be considered complete, go to the endpoint which returns your profile's data by roll number, take a clear screenshot which shows the url as well as the JSON data, and attach it to your PR. 

Example screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68962290/157040672-0127d8b5-bcf9-4887-b950-98bc8d2148b4.png)

items.title: Form fields are weirdly wide now
items.body:
As noted in https://github.com/vgteam/sequenceTubeMap/pull/147#issuecomment-1054591489, currently our form fields for selecting what to draw are much wider than they seem to need to be, and it makes our header take up a lot more space than it really should.

We should make them narrower so our header can be one or two rows on desktop screen sizes.

items.title: Custom added token with no icon is showing text instead of identicon

labels.name: Sev3-low
labels.description: Low severity; minimal to no impact upon users

items.body:
The text in the icon appears to be the token's name & balance, truncated within the icon's circle.

Experienced on the CowSwap site's add token button: https://cowswap.exchange/#/claim

items.title: Fix react warnings in tests
items.body:
Running the tests will generate React warnings, mostly about components that are unmounted getting async calls returned and trying to redraw.

We should fix them.

items.title: Mouse-over node IDs are confusing with redundant nodes removed
items.body: Removing the redundant nodes gives it a cleaner look, but the way it presents the node IDs is confusing. I believe the mouse-over only shows the first node ID. I spent a while confused about this because I thought there were missing nodes in the visualization. Perhaps it would be better to make the mouse-over give a list of IDs, or maybe an ID range?

items.title: Can't drag to pan vertically anymore
items.body:
If I zoom in on the tube map, so that the viewport gets as big as it is willing to get in my browser window, I get a vertical scroll bar popping up on the right edge of the viewport. I can pan vertically by adjusting that scrollbar, but I can't pan vertically by clicking and dragging on the image, like I do to pan horizontally.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5062495/50616522-a7d63b00-0e9d-11e9-80f8-5617fabe20c1.png)

Note the scrollbar on the right of the viewport, and how I'm stuck at the top of the displayed image.

I should be able to pan vertically and horizontally by clicking on the displayed image and dragging.

items.title: US: Copy Node Sequence
items.body:
I want to be able to copy-paste the sequence form a node, so I can BLAT it on the genome browser. When looking around in node mode, there's no position legend, so it's hard to find out where in the linear reference I am.

We could also have the scale bar in node mode. And maybe a "go to UCSC genome browser" button or something?

items.title: US: Link to current view
items.body:
I want to be able to record a view I have brought up in the tube map (including the combination of files, track settings, and start and length settings, with the files and position being the most important).

The UCSC Genome Browser solves this problem with "sessions", but I think a permalink-based approach might be better. I should be able to copy a link that when I open it takes me back to where I was.

items.title: Reads going out of bounds on the left aren't visible, while on the right they are cut off
items.body:
I'm looking for a read, so I enter the read's start node into the tube map in node mode and hit go.

I don't see the read. It's because (I think) the read maps to the reverse strand. The tube map starts at the node I entered and heads locally right, while the read wanders off locally left.

But I don't even see the part of the read that visits the node I entered. I think we might only be collecting reads fully withing the graph.

Starting at the read's ending node gets it to show up.

items.title: Handling of paths that leave and re-enter the displayed subgraph
items.body: Hello :) I am very grateful for your tool, but I found some unexpected behavior. * trackDoubleClick on the last track sometimes fails like this. * Nodes which are not adjacent are shown as if it is concatenated on the path. In this figure, the red and green lines seem to be concatenated, but they are not adjacent by observing input JSON's `rank`, which is generated by `vg find -x -P -c ` from our internal dataset. ``` {"name":"chr20","mapping":[{"position":{"node_id":22608},"rank":6042},{"position":{"node_id":22623},"rank":6057},{"position":{"node_id":22624},"rank":6058},{"position":{"node_id":22625},"rank":6059},{"position":{"node_id":22626},"rank":6060},{"position":{"node_id":22627},"rank":6061},{"position":{"node_id":22632},"rank":6066},{"position":{"node_id":22633},"rank":6067},{"position":{"node_id":22634},"rank":6068}]} ``` In the same reason, the scale shown on the path is not correct for green / red path. In my opinion, the link which the both nodes are not adjacent but on the same path had better be a dotted line. Moreover, I have several requests: * A callback called on dragging SVG to move left or right of genomic regions. * Enable to select an arbitrary color on each path. * Make nodeDoubleClick / trackDoubleClick more general API with callbacks. Sincerely,

items.title: Scaling Issue of Drawn Bases when Zooming.
items.body:
Hi There :)
When I zoom (in or out), the scaling of the drawn bases usually does not fit anymore. They are drawn too wide. 

Best,
Simon

items.title: Harmonisation BAL vs. BAN pour l'affichage des numros  plusieurs positions
items.body:
L'diteur utilise la premire des entres de la liste des positions d'un numro pour situer ce numro sur la carte (s'il y a plusieurs positions), alors que la BAN semble utiliser la dernire -> pourrait-on harmoniser cela pour avoir plus de prcision sur les points donnes ?

Illustration ci-dessous BAL vs. BAN (2nde image vs. 3e image) sur une adresse avec trois positions associes (dans lordre en Entre, Dlivrance Postale et Btiment, cf 1re image) -> La BAL utilise lEntre, alors que la BAN utilise le Btiment pour situer le point sur la carte ; personnellement linterprtation BAL est plus justifie, peut-tre faudrait-il conventionner ceci dans la spcification.

![pj1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33312469/130073244-0f803899-6bef-4eb3-ae69-293b36503d9b.png)
![pj2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33312469/130073248-40e2e170-2ad8-47e2-a9d7-46a3920e2ca3.png)
![pj3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33312469/130073249-bfbd64be-749e-4b51-a2af-fc8533b93b5b.png)

items.title: Make date/time consistent and localized
items.body:
As a user, I want to date and time shown across MetaMask to be consistent and internationally localized.

@Gudahtt recommended we use this [API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/DateTimeFormat) 

Relates to this issue that is progress:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/9377

items.title: OpenAPI/OAS 3 Server Variable Object url ':' before 'port' variable is invalid
items.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have written a descriptive issue title
- [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure the bug has not already been reported


### Fastify version

3.27.0

### Plugin version

4.13.1

### Node.js version

10.15

### Operating system

Linux

### Operating system version (i.e. 20.04, 11.3, 10)

20.04

### Description

According to OAS 3 spec [https://swagger.io/specification/#server-object](https://swagger.io/specification/#server-object) we should be able to use server variables including `port`, however a 500 error occurs with the following stack trace;


``` 
TypeError [ERR_INVALID_URL]: Invalid URL: https://authz.localdomain:{port}/{basePath}
    at onParseError (internal/url.js:241:17)
    at new URL (internal/url.js:319:5)
    at /app/node_modules/fastify-swagger/lib/spec/openapi/utils.js:73:22
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at normalizeUrl (/app/node_modules/fastify-swagger/lib/spec/openapi/utils.js:72:11)
    at Object.swagger (/app/node_modules/fastify-swagger/lib/spec/openapi/index.js:40:19)
    at Object.handler (/app/node_modules/fastify-swagger/lib/routes.js:101:26)
    at preHandlerCallback (/app/node_modules/fastify/lib/handleRequest.js:126:28)
    at preValidationCallback (/app/node_modules/fastify/lib/handleRequest.js:109:5)
    at handler (/app/node_modules/fastify/lib/handleRequest.js:72:7) +0ms
```

### Steps to Reproduce

Use the following server object

```
servers: [
      {
        url: 'https://authz.localdomain:{port}/{basePath}',
        description: 'Development server',
        variables: {
          port: {
            enum: ['443', '4432'],
            default: '4432',
          },
          basePath: {
            default: 'api',
          },
        },
      },
    ],
```

### Expected Behavior

No error should occur and the following url should be computed;

`https://authz.localdomain:4432/api`

items.title: Fastify schema allows omission of the type attribute for objects in path parameters, causing crashes in fastify-swagger
add missing types to [Issue 3664 test]
items.body:

Learn how to [contribute](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
